speaker: Max
text: Hey, I just finished reviewing the logging middleware that you added. It’s much cleaner than the old version.
ipa: heɪ, aɪ dʒəst ˈfɪnɪʃt rɪˈvjuːɪŋ ðə ˈlɒɡɪŋ ˈmɪdəlweə ðæt juː ˈædɪd. ɪts mʌʧ ˈkliːnə ðən ði əʊld ˈvɜːʃən.

speaker: Elena
text: Thanks! I refactored the part which was duplicating log entries across services.
ipa: θæŋks! aɪ riːˈfæktəd ðə pɑːt wɪʧ wəz ˈdjuːplɪkeɪtɪŋ lɒɡ ˈɛntriz əˈkrɒs ˈsɜːvɪsɪz.

speaker: Max
text: Good call. There’s a line in authHandler.js which still logs user IDs in plaintext, though. We might want to redact that.
ipa: ɡʊd kɔːl. ðɛəz ə laɪn ɪn ɔːθˈhændlər dʒeɪ ɛs wɪʧ stɪl lɒɡz ˈjuːzər aɪ diːz ɪn ˈpleɪnˌtɛkst, ðəʊ. wiː maɪt wɒnt tuː rɪˈdækt ðæt.

speaker: Elena
text: Ah, you're right. That's a leftover from the initial prototype, which I wrote during the hackathon.
ipa: ɑː, jɔː raɪt. ðæts ə ˈlɛftəʊvə frəm ði ɪˈnɪʃəl ˈprəʊtətaɪp, wɪʧ aɪ rəʊt ˈdjʊərɪŋ ðə ˈhækəθɒn.

speaker: Max
text: No worries. Also, the PR that introduced the email notifications had a test suite which you can probably reuse.
ipa: nəʊ ˈwʌriz. ˈɔːlsəʊ, ðə piː ɑː ðæt ˌɪntrəˈdjuːst ði ˈiːmeɪl ˌnəʊtɪfɪˈkeɪʃənz hæd ə tɛst swiːt wɪʧ juː kən ˈprɒbəbli ˌriːˈjuːz.

speaker: Elena
text: Yeah, I spoke with Sarah, who originally implemented that feature. She showed me a helper function which fakes the mailer response.
ipa: jæ, aɪ spəʊk wɪð ˈsɛərə, huː əˈrɪdʒɪnəli ˈɪmplɪˌmɛntɪd ðæt ˈfiːtʃə. ʃiː ʃəʊd miː ə ˈhɛlpə ˈfʌŋkʃən wɪʧ feɪks ðə ˈmeɪlə rɪˈspɒns.

speaker: Max
text: Cool. I also noticed that the new linter rule, which we added last sprint, flagged a few things in utils.js.
ipa: kuːl. aɪ ˈɔːlsəʊ ˈnəʊtɪst ðæt ðə njuː ˈlɪntə ruːl, wɪʧ wiː ˈædɪd lɑːst sprɪnt, flæɡd ə fjuː θɪŋz ɪn ˈjuːtɪlz dʒeɪ ɛs.

speaker: Elena
text: Yeah, I saw the warnings. They’re mostly about arrow function spacing, which I’ll fix before the next commit.
ipa: jæ, aɪ sɔː ðə ˈwɔːnɪŋz. ðɛə ˈməʊstli əˈbaʊt ˈærəʊ ˈfʌŋkʃən ˈspeɪsɪŋ, wɪʧ aɪl fɪks bɪˈfɔː ðə nɛkst kəˈmɪt.

speaker: Max
text: And that regex validator — is it something which we wrote ourselves, or is it part of the open-source lib?
ipa: ænd ðæt ˈriːdʒɛks ˈvælɪdeɪtə — ɪz ɪt ˈsʌmθɪŋ wɪʧ wiː rəʊt aʊəˈsɛlvz, ɔːr ɪz ɪt pɑːt əv ði ˈəʊpən sɔːs lɪb?

speaker: Elena
text: It’s from a package which we forked last year. We fixed a bug which was causing false positives on email domains.
ipa: ɪts frəm ə ˈpækɪdʒ wɪʧ wiː fɔːkt lɑːst jɪə. wiː fɪkst ə bʌɡ wɪʧ wəz ˈkɔːzɪŋ fɔːls ˈpɒzətɪvz ɒn ˈiːmeɪl dəˈmeɪnz.

speaker: Max
text: Nice. This is the kind of attention to detail that keeps our codebase healthy.
ipa: naɪs. ðɪs ɪz ðə kaɪnd əv əˈtɛnʃən tuː ˈdiːteɪl ðæt kiːps aʊə ˈkəʊdbeɪs ˈhɛlθi.

speaker: Elena
text: Appreciate that. It’s good to work on a project where people actually read the docs and review properly.
ipa: əˈpriːʃieɪt ðæt. ɪts ɡʊd tuː wɜːk ɒn ə ˈprɒdʒɛkt weə ˈpiːpl ˈæktʃuəli riːd ðə dɒks ənd rɪˈvjuː ˈprɒpəli.
